natural solution: Distributing the exponent and using the power of a power law, we have $(2x^3)^3=(2^3)((x^{3})^3)=8(x^{3\ast3})=\boxed{8x^9}$.

fixes x :: real
shows  "(2 * (x powr 3)) powr 3 = 8 * (x powr 9)"
a_0.formal solution:

 ### Proof
 Distributing the exponent and using the power of a power law, we have $(2x^3)^3=(2^3)((x^{3})^3)=8(x^{3\ast3})=\boxed{8x^9}$.

theorem
fixes x :: real
shows  "(2 * (x powr 3)) powr 3 = 8 * (x powr 9)"
